metadata.title: CVE-2018-17175 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS. (noble) - low
metadata.description:
In the marshmallow library before 2.15.1 and 3.x before 3.0.0b9 for Python,the schema "only" option treats an empty list as implying no "only" option,which allows a request that was intended to expose no fields to insteadexpose all fields (if the schema is being filtered dynamically using the"only" option, and there is a user role that produces an empty value for"only").

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-17175` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

python3-marshmallow - 3.0.0b14-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: python-marshmallow package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.0.0b14-1').
